intro: Nematanthus nervosus, commonly known as the velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, velvety leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from purple to blue. The plant is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in disturbed soils or along forest edges. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many climbing and twining plants. The flowers bloom during the day and are pollinated by insects, making it an important species in its native ecosystem.
